Ask HN: How to avoid overthinking when working on projects
text:
I have this problem where I tend to overthink when I'm working on a side project.

In actuality I would prefer to build something crappy than to build nothing at all. At least that way I have something cool to show to people.

But I find it tough to stop my mind from thinking stuff like "this thing you're working on isn't going to work, it's probably not going to be useful at all. let's just stop working on it"

As a result I find it really hard to work on side projects and I end up wasting that time on consuming useless things like social media and video games.

How do I stop myself from overthinking when building side projects and just do it and finish it?

PostgresML launches free hosted tutorial notebooks
text:
Hi HN!

It's been a few months and we've been coding a lot. For those of you who missed our first post, we're building an end-to-end machine learning solution that runs alongside your favorite database.

This time we are launching a free tier of hosted notebooks and tutorials for you to explore using PostgresML with a click of a button (we really tried to make the sign up as easy as possible).

Check us out at https://postgresml.org and sign up for our "gym" at https://gym.postgresml.org/signup/.

Let us know what you think!

Montana & Lev

Free Unlimited Stock/Finance API
text:
Hey everyone,

I have an investing app, so I am paying (quite a bit) for a subscription to get financial data for the app. While building this, I always wished that I could have free access to this information. I would love to provide this information as an API for free, but I wanted to know what sorts of info people would want. Ideally, I would only like to create a few endpoints so it’s easier to track. Feel free to check out my app (Hubble Investing) and let me know what information you would like from there in an endpoint.

Note: I won’t be able to provide the AI as an endpoint because that model is stored locally in the app.

Ask HN: Best Beginner Books on Cryptography?
text:
In particular, I'm trying to wrap my head around the different algorithms available, how much protection they provide, and how they differ from one another in an academic sense (no opinions unless they're circumstantial).

Not looking to implement my own algorithms or do analysis, just looking to remove naivety and be able to say "oh, don't use that one because of ___, or, use that one because of ___." Practical/prescriptive information would be a bonus.
